glyphs.name: CYCLIC
glyphs.description: Continuous circular flow with a right-side arrow bridging a deliberate gap, representing recursive temporal momentum.
design_notes: Arrowhead indicates ongoing momentum, not just a closed loop.
Gap avoids collision with the 'simple circle' topology.
Geometry is tuned for skeleton stability and PSH-256 canonicalization.
Arrow placement is irrelevant due to D4 normalization.

name: ERUPTIVE
description: A vertical eruption channel with three outward flares, symbolizing upward release of built pressure.
design_notes: Vertical spine represents the eruption conduit.
Three arcs provide directional expansion.
Asymmetry conveys upward force.
D4 invariance ensures orientation independence for the hash.

name: STAGNANT
description: Horizontal bar representing complete temporal stillness and zero momentum
design_notes: Pure horizontal line = zero vertical momentum
Centered position represents balanced stasis
Substantial length conveys temporal extension (duration of stillness)
Blunt line caps (not rounded) emphasize hard stop
Simplest possible topology = irreducible concept
D4 canonicalization will identify horizontal as primary orientation

name: TURBULENT
description: Chaotic zigzag representing irregular temporal flow with broken periodicity
design_notes: Irregular zigzag with variable angles creates unpredictability
Upward-rightward trend shows forward motion despite chaos
Sharp angles (not curves) emphasize disruption
6-7 direction changes provide sufficient complexity
Pattern avoids perfect symmetry to maintain chaotic feel

name: DISSIPATIVE
description: Downward arrow with fade lines representing gradual energy dissipation
design_notes: Downward arrow indicates decreasing trajectory
Fade lines at bottom show energy dispersing into environment
Thinner fade lines (0.75px) + reduced opacity create visual decay
Smooth shaft (not zigzag) indicates gradual, controlled dissipation
Opposite of ERUPTIVE (down vs up, gradual vs sudden)
